abstract: Afghan government and Taliban confirm that they are holding talks in Qatar but deny that discussions amount to peace talks; public hopes remain high, nonetheless, that meeting may serve as precursor to peace negotiations.
lead_paragraph: Although they insisted that the meetings were not for peace talks or negotiations, neither side denied this time that the sessions were taking place.

headline.main: Afghan and Taliban Representatives Meet in Qatar
headline.print_headline: Afghans Hold Meeting With Taliban in Qatar

snippet: Although they insisted that the meetings were not for peace talks or negotiations, neither side denied this time that the sessions were taking place.
